repnme.cdata!:
Turkey’s energy reforms for a sustainable
            energy future

abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile talks about
            Turkey's reforms for a sustainable energy future.
            Turkey faced increasing domestic energy demand and rapidly
            growing greenhouse gas emissions, a large portion of which
            come from energy production and usage. International Bank
            for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) has supported
            Turkey’s energy reforms significantly over the last decade
            by utilizing the full range of World Bank lending and
            technical support in ways that complement and reinforce each
            other. The government of Turkey, with IBRD support, has
            transformed its energy sector to increase competition,
            expand private investment and promote sustainable use of its
            renewable energy resources. Turkey has improved the
            efficiency of its electricity market while increasing
            private sector participation in power distribution and
            generation. The World Bank’s work has helped in attracting
            large-scale private investment, particularly in renewable
            resources. Significant new financing has been brought in to
            support new investments in generation, and also in
            privatized distribution. Turkey’s energy sector has
            transformed from one that was monolithic and state-owned
            into a commercially run and liberalized market, with private
            investment and ownership in several parts of the sector.

docna.cdata!:
Turkey’s energy reforms for a sustainable
            energy future

display_title.display_title:
Turkey’s energy reforms for a
            sustainable energy future

repnme.cdata!:
Turkey overall energy program profile :
            Turkey's comprehensive energy reform program puts
            development on a sustainable path

abstracts.cdata!:
International Bank for Reconstruction
            and Development (IBRD) support to Turkey's energy
            reforms have helped the government turn a monolithic,
            state-run sector into a competitive energy market that has
            connected an additional 4.6 million households to a more
            stable electricity grid. A development policy loan (DPL)
            supporting the energy sector reforms and their link to the
            environment under environmental sustainability and energy
            sector (ESES) DPL is at advanced stage of preparation. The
            Bank is also currently finalizing several pieces of advisory
            work covering energy efficiency, utility demand side
            management, and a capacity building program for the
            electricity market operator.

docna.cdata!:
Turkey overall energy program profile :
            Turkey's comprehensive energy reform program puts
            development on a sustainable path

display_title.display_title:
Turkey overall energy program
            profile : Turkey's comprehensive energy reform program
            puts development on a sustainable path

repnme.cdata!:
Turkey overall energy program profile :
            Turkey's comprehensive energy reform program puts
            development on a sustainable path

abstracts.cdata!:
International Bank for Reconstruction
            and Development (IBRD) support to Turkey's energy
            reforms have helped the government turn a monolithic,
            state-run sector into a competitive energy market that has
            connected an additional 4.6 million households to a more
            stable electricity grid. A development policy loan (DPL)
            supporting the energy sector reforms and their link to the
            environment under environmental sustainability and energy
            sector (ESES) DPL is at advanced stage of preparation. The
            Bank is also currently finalizing several pieces of advisory
            work covering energy efficiency, utility demand side
            management, and a capacity building program for the
            electricity market operator.

Turkey overall energy program profile :
            Turkey's comprehensive energy reform program puts
            development on a sustainable path

            profile : Turkey's comprehensive energy reform program
